trans-unit.source: Stride uses a package system, wherein each game is contained in a package; a game can also use content from other packages. Thus, sharing resources across multiple games becomes possible.
trans-unit.target: Stride uses a package system, wherein each game is contained in a package; a game can also use content from other packages. Thus, sharing resources across multiple games becomes possible.

trans-unit.source: A package is a container for:
trans-unit.target: A package is a container for:

trans-unit.source: A dependency is a reference from one package to another package, which allows another package to use the contents from this package. When a package is a game, it also contains code executables (one per platform) along with game assets, code libraries, and dependencies.
trans-unit.target: A dependency is a reference from one package to another package, which allows another package to use the contents from this package. When a package is a game, it also contains code executables (one per platform) along with game assets, code libraries, and dependencies.

trans-unit.source: Packages are saved on your hard-disk with the .sdpkg extension.
trans-unit.target: Packages are saved on your hard-disk with the .sdpkg extension.
